parameters.content:
## About n8n workflow
This is a comprehensive BIM/CAD classification and analysis pipeline that:

1. **Extracts** data from Revit/IFC/DWG/DGN files
2. **Processes** and groups element data
3. **Classifies** elements using AI and mapping files
4. **Generates** professional reports

Supports multiple classification systems

# LLM-CAD-BIM Classification Engine + RAG
Large Language Model Engine and RAG for UniverCAD-sal Classification BIM
DataDrivenConstruction [GitHub](https://github.com/datadrivenconstruction/cad2data-Revit-IFC-DWG-DGN-pipeline-with-conversion-validation-qto)

## üìù Setup Instructions

1. In the 'Setup - Define file paths' node, specify:
   - Path to converter (RvtExporter.exe)
   - Path to project file (.rvt)
   - Grouping parameter (group_by, e.g. 'Type Name', 'IfcType' for IFC or other)
   - Country (country for which the values will be calculated, e.g. 'Germany'or 'Brazil')

2. Ensure API keys for OpenAI and Anthropic are set in credentials or just connect other models that you use in your work (of course, these can be open source LLMs)

options.systemMessage:
You are an expert in Revit, BIM (Building Information Modeling) and construction classification. Your task is to classify category values as either building elements or non-building elements (drawings, annotations, etc.).

Building elements include:
- Structural elements (walls, floors, roofs, columns, beams, foundations, slabs)
- MEP elements (pipes, ducts, equipment, fixtures, mechanical equipment)
- Architectural elements (doors, windows, stairs, railings, curtain walls)
- Site elements (parking, roads, landscaping)
- Furniture and fixtures
- Any physical construction element that has volume, area, or physical properties

Non-building elements include:
- Drawings and sheets
- Annotations, dimensions, text notes
- Views, sections, elevations, plans
- Tags, symbols, legends, schedules
- Grids, levels, reference planes
- Revision clouds, callouts, detail items
- Lines, filled regions, detail lines
- Any 2D documentation or annotation element

IMPORTANT: Analyze the actual category name, not just keywords. For example:
- "Detail Items" = non-building (annotation)
- "Plumbing Fixtures" = building element
- "Room Tags" = non-building (annotation)
- "Structural Columns" = building element

Return ONLY valid JSON in this exact format:
{
  "classifications": {
    "category_value_1": true,
    "category_value_2": false
  },
  "building_categories": ["list", "of", "building", "categories"],
  "drawing_categories": ["list", "of", "drawing", "categories"]
}

parameters.text:
Analyze these {{ $json.totalHeaders }} headers and determine aggregation method for each:

Headers with sample values:
{{ JSON.stringify($json.sampleValues, null, 2) }}

Provide aggregation rule for EACH header listed above.

options.systemMessage:
You are an expert in construction classification systems. Analyze building element groups and assign aggregation methods for grouping data.

Rules:
1. 'sum' - for quantities that should be totaled:
   - Volume, Area, Length, Width, Height, Depth, Size
   - Count, Quantity, Number, Amount, Total
   - Thickness, Perimeter, Dimension
   - Weight, Mass, Load
   - Any measurable physical property that accumulates

2. 'mean' (average) - for rates and unit values:
   - Price, Cost, Rate (per unit)
   - Coefficient, Factor, Ratio
   - Percentage, Percent
   - Efficiency, Performance metrics
   - Any per-unit or normalized values

3. 'first' - for descriptive/categorical data:
   - ID, Code, Number (when used as identifier)
   - Name, Title, Description
   - Type, Category, Class, Group
   - Material, Component, Element
   - Project, Building, Location
   - Status, Phase, Stage
   - Any text or categorical field

IMPORTANT: 
- Analyze each header carefully
- Consider both the header name AND sample value
- Return aggregation rule for EVERY header provided
- Use exact header names from input

Return ONLY valid JSON in this exact format:
{
  "aggregation_rules": {
    "Header1": "sum",
    "Header2": "first",
    "Header3": "mean"
  }
}

parameters.content:
## Block 1: Conversion Block
This block:
- Checks if Excel file exists from Revit project
- If not, runs converter to extract data
- If yes, skips to save time








Simply: Converts Revit file to Excel for analysis.

Key nodes:
- Check - Does Excel file exist?: Verifies file
- Extract - Run converter: Converts if needed

## Block 2: Data Loading & Grouping
This block:
- Loads Excel data
- Cleans headers
- Uses AI to decide aggregation (sum for quantities, mean 
for rates, first for texts)
- Groups data by parameter (e.g., Type Name)
Simply: Prepares raw data for classification.

## Block 3: Element Classification Block
This block:
- Identifies category fields in the data
- Uses AI to classify categories as building elements 
or drawing/annotation elements
- Filters out non-building elements (drawings, tags, annotations)
- Applies classification to all element groups

Simply: Separates real building elements from documentation elements

## Block 4: Classification & Mapping Block
This block:
- Processes building elements through classification system
- Reads optional mapping/classification file (Excel, CSV, PDF, etc.)
- Extracts classification codes and descriptions
- Uses AI to enhance and complete the classification dictionary
- Applies classifications to each element group

Simply: Maps building elements to standard classification codes

## Block 5: Batch Classification Processing
This block:
- Processes elements in batches for efficiency
- Prepares classification prompts with context
- Uses AI to classify each element according to the specified system
- Parses and validates classification results
- Accumulates all classified elements

Simply: AI-powered classification of building elements

## Block 6: Report Generation Block
This block:
- Calculates project totals and statistics
- Generates comprehensive HTML report with charts and visualizations
- Creates multi-sheet Excel file with detailed analysis
- Saves reports to project folder
- Opens HTML report in browser automatically

Simply: Creates professional reports from classified data

## Available AI Models

Connect any of these models to the workflow:

1. **OpenRouter** - Access to multiple models
2. **OpenAI** - GPT-4 and other models
3. **Anthropic** - Claude models
4. **Google Gemini** - Gemini Pro
5. **xAI Grok** - Grok models

Models are used for:
- Header analysis
- Category classification
- Element classification
- Mapping extraction

## Config here and run

















### Configure File Paths here
In the **'Setup - Define file paths'** node, set:
- `path_to_converter`: Full path to RvtExporter.exe (e.g., C:\DDC_Converter\RvtExporter.exe)
- `project_file`: Path to your CAD/BIM file (.rvt, .ifc, .dwg, .dgn)
- `group_by`: Grouping parameter (e.g., 'Type Name', 'Category', 'IfcType')
- `classification_name`: Target system (Omniclass, Uniclass, MasterFormat, etc.)
- `optional_mapping_file`: Path to classification mapping file (Excel/CSV/PDF)
- `optional_help_prompt`: Additional context for AI (e.g., "Focus on structural elements")
